byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from Washington, and Julia Preston from Dilley, Tex.
byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JULIA PRESTON

abstract: United States Court of Appeals for Fifth Circuit, in New Orleans, rules, 2-1, that Pres Obama cannot move forward with his plans to overhaul immigration rules by providing work permits to millions and offering protection against deportation.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court said the president could not move forward with his plans to overhaul immigration rules by providing up to five million people with work permits and protection from deportation.

headline.main: Appeals Court Deals Blow to Obama’s Immigration Plans
headline.print_headline: Appeals Court Deals Blow to Obama’s Plans to Overhaul Immigration Rules

snippet: A federal appeals court said the president could not move forward with his plans to overhaul immigration rules by providing up to five million people with work permits and protection from deportation.
